description.narrative: Citizen engagement is increased to support the realization of boys' and girls' rights., which contributes to Child Protection â€“ General, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas (Covid), Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, engaged citizens, including boys, girls and families, millennials, individual donors and private sector partners, are driving public action for the realization of children's rights.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Citizen engagement is increased to support the realization of boys’ and girls’ rights.

description.narrative: UNICEF used the 30th anniversary of the CRC and the 20th anniversary of UNICEF Municipal Seal programme to mobilize the broad public for a recommitment to children's rights, reaching 310 million people and engaging 6.5 million of them through its emergency and advocacy campaigns. The support of celebrities and influencers was key to leverage Reach and Engagement. Building on last years' experience of using a chatbot to discuss sensitive issues, UNICEF developed new projects to engage young audiences against xenophobia and to strengthen self-esteem and to position UNICEF as an innovative organization. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020
